caption: Kayley and Taylor were amazing bartenders! Mariana was also very sweet. Delicious drinks and great hospitality.
Kayley is hot

It was my first time in Tampa and the view was amazing. Our server Mariana suggested the Cajun Shrimp Corn Fritters and they were absolutely amazing.  The experience is top notch. Definitely a five star rating.

You can't go wrong with this one. The staff was friendly and attentive, which was the cherry on top to already great views, food, and drinks. This will be a must visit for me whenever I am in the area again.

This was by far the absolute WORST service and food I have ever had in Tampa. Our party sat for 20 mins before our drink order was taken. It then took another 42 minutes to receive our drinks from the bar. Our food was ordered after the drinks but arrived before our cocktails did. You could tell the staff was just in a complete state of chaos. My husband had the filet, which was a whole 1/2 inch in thickness. (You could buy a better steak at Publix) my grouper was so over cooked it was like chewing rubber. It is so sad bc the restaurant itself is beautiful but I would never subject myself to that kind of dining experience ever again. I hope they get their act together.....

Food tastes good. Service was great. Couldn't tell if my rum and coke was just a coke. Couldn't tell if my spicy margarita was just lime juice with muddled jalapeño. Wasn't thrilled in the slightest that I paid $18 for two scallops.

Great atmosphere and drinks. The food was great, even though I'd  love to see some more options. I actually appreciated the reasonable portions. But please please do something about the service: we had to wait soo long for everything.. food, drinks, refills, napkins.. etc and one of the ladies kept bringing us stuff to our table which was not ours (4times!!). It kind of ruins the overall experience.

Located in the Loft Hotel on the 7th floor. Valet employees very professional y extremely nice! First impression, walking in there was no host to greet us. We waited for a lil while. Once seated, we waited again. Our server was polite. Dinner Menu is simple and to the point. We were served plantain chips with a very delicious dip called crema. That dip is the bomb. I requested the filet mignon, came with sweet potato & kale. The sauce they used was good but it is spicy so be aware. You can request a Garlic based sauce (found out after the fact). Server requested a kale plate with the garlic sauce, it was way better for me since I do not like spicy. Filet Mignon was not cooked at medium. Seemed dry on the outside but overall it wasn't bad. My BF had the steak tacos, he said they were alright. I had a drink special ketel one botanical vodka spritz. Pleasantly surprised on how good it was. Overall, customer service is my pet peave... greetings & initial contact with customers is extremely important, especially in a timely manner. (side note: it wasn't packed or crowded). Food can definitely be better. I did like the decor! Assessment for me would be a 3.5 I know this is a new place, hopefully it gets better.
WOW what a place to see the sunset. Will be back weekly

The food was great! The place was very nice,  but the service was not that great! We had to wait too long for a menu and for drinks. The worse part was the vallet, keys were lost and we had to wait almost 1hr for the car.

If you’re looking for a centrally located, beautiful, contemporary, sophisticated and open space this is it. Sal y Mar has a modern rustic feel, the rooftop patio space wraps around the main restaurant and has the most beautiful view of the Downtown Tampa. The perfect place to catch the sunset. There is a variety of drinks and handhelds, one of the only rooftop bars that has a full menu. I highly recommend asking for Mariana, she made our experience perfect by checking on us, recommending and explaining entrees, and making sure we had a clear table after each course. She was extremely sweet and helpful when going through a new drink and food menu.

Had a great time and the outside view was really nice. Our server Iris was really great and sweet. The shrimp corn fritters were delicious. I ordered the grouper...it was a little dry and chewy...but overall a nice experience.
The atmosphere was nice.. The shrimp and grits were delicious. Would definitely go back
First time there and loved it! The view is breathtaking, our waitress was absolutely awesome, food was also good. A little pricey but it’s to be expected.Happy hour was definitely a plus.

It started from entering the building. They didn’t have our reservations some how so we sat outside which we found a table pretty quick but we requested inside for our reservations from the cold. Then the server forgot to bring us water like five times and waiting over 30 mins for every drink order. Then the charcuterie board that was $18 and it was cheeses and meats in the size of a one person sample and the selection was worse then what a grocery store has. Being new you would have thought they would have been on top of it.

This a brand new restaurant and they nailed food and customer service.  You need to make reservations for the interior restaurant and the outside area is first come first serve.  Let me tell you food and mocktail were on point.  The atmosphere and ambiance is very trendy and relax.  Again servers and bartenders were amazing.
Amazing view and the service staff was nice but the Drinks were meh. My partners and I ordered a total of 4 drinks and they were all terrible.
Food was good. Service was great

Definitely going to want to wait till they get their operation figured out before visiting. Placed on a sms wait list for outside seating where they don't take reservations. Waited in the lobby lounge. Saw a few people walk outside an sit, approached the hostess station this time greeted by one of the managers and was informed that outside was open seating and no waiting list was offered. Too bad outside looked like a beautiful place and we could have purchased some drinks while we waited but wasn't "allowed" to go to bar and order a drink due to covid restrictions
Whoever said, '. Can see St Peter & Clearwater from this location much have bee drunk. The manager couldn't show me a view of Clearwater due to all the buildings are taller than the bar.
Always love checking out new spots. On my last trip to Tampa the GF and I hit this one up. Great choice. Loved the vibe and the drinks were on point. I'll definitely be back next time.

The food, ambience, and customer service were fantastic. However, I believe the price for the food and cocktails were a bit expensive for what you receive. Either the items need a few dollars less or make them a bit more shareable for what you pay.
Great sunset & service! Mariana was sweet and attentive. The bees knees was a great recommendation, Definitely will be back!

For the $142.00 cost of dinner I expected a lot better quality and service.  I made reservations online for 7:00 p.m. the night of my reservation I called to see about moving it up to 615. The lady on the phone advised me to follow and click the link on a confirmation text I received. I did that under no way to change or modify your reservation. I called back to advise and she said that she could not change my reservation because they were only told that way by clicking the link. I advised her that there is no way to change your reservation from clicking that link and she responded by asking me if I scroll to the bottom of the page. Yes I sure did I am not an imbecile. I then asked for the restaurant manager and she said she was the restaurant manager. Again she confirmed she didnt know how to change a reservation but just come in cause they are not busy.  I guess she never heard of a pander pencil in the piece of paper to simply write a note down to make sure that a reservation is changed that's what they get for trying to be overly modern but not ready for it.  Getting there there is no parking for the restaurant I would suggest try to park in the hotel parking for free rather than use the valet which you feel obligated to leave a tip.  Getting seated was another mess we walked up to the restaurant said we had a reservation and said we would like to sit outside we were told it's open seating so go sit wherever you want. Next we walk outside and all the tables near the railing with the best view all had reserved signs on it.  When you make your reservation it says you can't reserve certain seating it's 1st come 1st served so these reserved signs were pretty confusing. Asking one of the servers was a mistake because she described it as yes they are reserved you can have any table you want they can all be yours but they are all reserved.  I may not be the brightest bulb but I tell you what hearing that come out of her mouth was pretty damn confusing. At this point we just sat down at a table.  For being not very crowded at all and a Monday service food everything with very very slow.  Currently the entire places under construction so the views that are being painted on their photo are also often obstructed and not so picturesque currently.  At $14 for each drink I think they must get a commission because O my goodness did they push those drinks.  We were asked if we wanted drinks 1st then water was brought then asked we wanted drinks again.  Order drinks because I felt like it was kind of what we were supposed to do and then had to tell her we would like some appetisers. Next appetisers came out we had our drinks. Finish the appetisers and she comes over do anything else well yes we came here for dinner so we were like to put in our entree order. That's correct we put in drinks appetisers ate the appetisers before she even asked if we wanted something else.  At the 30 minute mark of not getting our entrees to server comes over and says very nervous and very polite but basically says that the kitchen has messed up my food and that they were going to give us a round of drinks for free. Trying to be understandable we said OK and we got the same drinks that we got before.  This is where it gets really sloppy.Both drinks that we got originally were good.   The new drinks regard were very sloppy they were in either a different type of glass or they were missing ingredients. When the missing ingredients were brought up the bartender if you want to call her that may no attempt to professionally prepare the drink again rather than dumping a large amount of cinnamon directly in the center of the drink.  All this showed me was her lack of class and what came out as frustration in my drink because she messed it up and had to fix it. I am putting photos of Before & After of all of these things so you can see for yourself.  I won't say I will go back at least right now or anytime soon they are far away from being able to say they are worth a $140 for dinner for 2.Even when they tried to fix it with the drinks there bartender lac

Came here for my birthday with a small group of friends.  Nice atmosphere. But I would not recommend ordering any food as most of us did not enjoy the dishes we had. Drinks and cocktails were inconsistent. It took a very long time to get our food and drinks as well. Service was just alright but slow as well. I was served very last and still had to wait long while Before my Panini came out and everyone else had started eating.  There were not many people there on a Monday night.  Was really curious to visit this place as it just opened up not too long ago. But it doesn’t live up to its hype and quality you would expect from a brand new rooftop restaurant/ bar.
My husband and I had an incredible time at Sal Y Mar.  The filet was melt in your mouth goodness.  Their Cuban has me wishing they did lunch.  We can't wait to go back.
The drinks are not that good. The food is horribly portioned for the price.
Great and unique experience, wonderful food, outstanding service. Highly recommended. A+
It’s gonna be a popular spot soon

I stopped by on I believe it was a Friday night so I anticipated it to be busy. I decided to sit outside and I must say the view from the rooftop is spectacular. The music gives the bar a very upbeat vibe. Old Fashion's and Manhattan's are my go to when I'm trying to gauge a new spot. I ordered both that night and Brandon my wonderful bartender definitely didn't disappoint. They were both just what I was wanting and his personality really helped sell me on staying for the 3rd. Oh and I loved his hat 🤠🥃  I will certainly be coming back with friends as long as he's there to bartend for us!!
Ambiance and vibe are great. Unfortunately, the food is awful.

My family and I went on 2/15/21 for dinner and drinks. The night started off with the waitress dropping water on the small table we were seated at. I knew the night was headed down hill when we had to ask for a napkin 10 minutes later to clean the water from the table. We ordered our drinks; which were not that bad. It took 25 minutes I would say to get our drinks. It was a Monday and it was not busy. We ordered our food and it just went south after that. The food was very bland, no flavor at all. I ordered a burger well done and it came out pink. Someone else ordered a burger with just lettuce and cheese and it came out with everything on it. We ordered a new burger and waited an hour and still nothing came. We asked for salt and pepper for the asparagus and it never came. We were so hungry due to small food portions that when we left we went and ordered an XL pie from papa johns. The service and food were horrible, but hey the views were great!
Brand new place. Stopped in with my girlfriends to check it out. Great food, great atmosphere, great views! Will definitely be back.
Visited this rooftop bar on a quick trip to Tampa. We very much enjoyed the vibe, food, and drinks! Would visit again.

Came to have drinks and check out all the hype (good and the bad) reviews! First the views are amazing but the service from the start was spot on thanks (Brandon) I don't like gin but the waterloo drink was fabulous. Slow clap for the ones in the back - the grouper was a hit!! I will definitely be back with all my girlfriends 🐱
Great spot. The food was really good and service was spot on. Drinks were pretty good, not the strongest... full disclosure -I’m a borderline alcoholic.
Beautiful location! Great food and awesome drinks. Will definitely be back
Awesome new place! Highly recommend checking it out.

Location has a lot of potential with great views of downtown Tampa and a decent attempt at achieving a Tulum vibe BUT that only carries you so far when the average cocktail is $14 and bar bites are more than the average entree. We arrived for an 8p reservation and were sat at a very tiny tiny table when there weren’t many other people there (on a Weds night). Service was EXTREMELY slow. In 35 mins (again with hardly anyone there) we finished a carafe of water and 1 margarita and our glasses sat empty. We ordered the shrimp fritters and they arrived with little to no flavor. I hope they’re just working out the kinks but we’d label it as an overpriced hotel bar, at best.
Great views, design, and drinks. Bruschetta was awesome.
I haven’t been here but the reviews alone are making me scared to even try. What does the owner have to say to all the bad reviews? More bad reviews than good, it’s frightening!

This place has no customer service, we were 8 minutes late to our reservation, we called to advise because we hadn’t been there before. We get there  and the manager tries to sit us at the bar when there are many tables that are available; food is subpar at best. Waitress even took my friends drink order and skipped over me.

If we could give this place no stars that would be too much. Horrible service. Horrible food. They take 30 min to an hour to bring you anything. They are not even apologetic when you question them. Stay away from this place.

Super cute place EXCEPT the customer service is non-existent. Called a day ahead to make reservations for the outside rooftop and was told it was on a “first come, first served basis”. Called the day of for directions and to confirm what time the rooftop was opening. Was told the same thing “it opens at 4 and it’s on a first come, first serve basis”. Arrived a few minutes earlier than opening time and was told it was “Reservation Only” with quiet the attitude from one of the employees. We explained the situation and that we were told TWICE that it was on a first come, first serve basis. If you call the recording for the restaurant it clearly says “first come, first serve basis”. Absolutely nothing but attitude was given even from the manager Juan who was nothing but dry and condescending. Try Bulla Gastrobar instead.

Horrible experience. Terrible customer service. The manager was so rude! I was shocked to find out she was a manager. We assumed she was a hostess because she was bringing people to their tables. Took 20 minutes to receive drinks. The server told us there was a blueberry mojito on special. No mint leaves, tasted watered down, was flavored with bright blue food coloring and sugar. Unable to even drink it. The cheese board was dry and tasted old!
No costumer service and staff is rude. Hotel okay.
The rooftop is beautiful, food was delicious and the employees provided excellent service! Very chic and upscale. Great place to relax and enjoy the view with lounge music.
Do not go here! Service was the worst.
Great new rooftop restaurant and bar. Only opened yesterday and the staff were on it!  Excellent service and ambiance.
